headlines.description: Scott McTominay and Anthony Martial scored as Manchester United secured a well-earned 2-0 victory over Everton.
headlines.shortLinkText: Man Utd beat Everton to reinforce top four place

headlines.description: Bertrand Traore and Ollie Watkins earned Aston Villa a 2-0 win over Nottingham Forest to keep them on course for a place in Europe.
headlines.shortLinkText: Villa up to sixth in Prem as winning run continues

headlines.description: Newcastle United moved back up to third in the Premier League with a hard-fought 2-1 victory at Brentford on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Newcastle back up to third with 2-1 win at Brentford after Ton

headlines.description: A first-half own goal gave West Ham three vital points in the battle against relegation as they beat Fulham 1-0 at Craven Cottage on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Own goal gives West Ham much-needed win

headlines.description: Leicester City's relegation plight worsened as they suffered a 1-0 home defeat by fellow strugglers Bournemouth on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Leicester relegation fears grow with Bournemouth loss

events.name: Brighton & Hove Albion at Tottenham Hotspur

headlines.description: — Harry Kane scored his 23rd English Premier League goal to earn Tottenham a 2-1 win over top-four rival Brighton on Saturday in a match that saw both managers sent off after a touchline scuffle.
headlines.shortLinkText: Kane nets winner for Spurs vs. Brighton; 2 managers sent off

headlines.description: Frank Lampard got off to a losing start on his return as interim Chelsea manager on Saturday with the Blues beaten 1-0 at Wolverhampton Wanderers.
headlines.shortLinkText: Lampard makes a losing return as Chelsea boss

headlines.description: Erling Haaland netted a brilliant bicycle kick for his 30th Premier League goal this season as Manchester City beat Southampton 4-1 on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Haaland nets 30th PL goal as City thrash Saints
